lines.content: * Duke is an interactive bot that helps the user to note down important tasks.
* @param filePath the location of a textfile containing the user's list of tasks, relative to the root directory.
* Kickstarts the Duke bot to begin taking in and reacting to user input.
* Parser deals with understanding the user's input and create the correspondign Command to deal with the request.
* Parses a single line from the user input that is broken up into 2 strings. The first string is the first
* command word, and the second string is the details of the command. From here, the command word is checked to
* decide on whether to respond with an appropriate command, or an exception if the command is not recognized.
* @param cmd the first word in a line from the user's input
* @param details the subsequent words in the same line from the user
* @return an appropriate Command based on the user's request
public static Command parse(String cmd, String details) throws DukeException {

* finds all tasks that have details that are related to the keyword.

* Says goodbye to the user as the app shuts down.
* Prints out a given list of tasks for the user to see.
* @param tasks arraylist of desired tasks to show the user.
* used when a task has been successfully deleted.
System.out.println("Noted. I've removed this task:\n" + t);
* used when a task has been successfully added.
System.out.println("Noted. I've added this task:\n" + t);
* used wehn a task was successully marked as incomplete or complete.
* @param isComplete boolean flag for wehether the task was marked complete or not complete.
public void notifyMarkedTaskMessage(Task t, boolean isComplete) {
System.out.println("Task " + t + " has been marked complete.");
System.out.println("Task " + t + " has been marked incomplete.");
* Responsible for adding new tasks to the list of tasks

throw new DukeException("â˜¹ OOPS!!! The description cannot be empty.");
* Constuctor 2 that deals with adding a Deadline or Event item. These have a date and need to be handled

* @param cmd the type of task, whether event or deadline
* @param details description and date of the task
public AddCommand(String cmd, String details) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("â˜¹ OOPS!!! The description cannot be empty.");

* Adds the new task to the existing list of tasks, notifies the user
* of the completion of the task, and updates the user's file.
* @param tasks holds all the tasks that the user has recorded down.
* @param ui used to notify the user of task completion.
* @param storage saves the tasks to file if there were any edits to it.
public void execute(TaskMaster tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Command is the action that needs to be taken to carry out the user's request.
* @throws DukeException as the user might leave out crtiical information or input wrong commands.
* Kickstarts the actions to execute in order to carry out the command.
* @param tasks   holds all the tasks that the user has recorded down.
* @param ui      used to notify the user of task completion.
* @param storage saves the tasks to file if there were any edits to it.
public abstract void execute(TaskMaster tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws DukeException;
* checks whether the the command was an exit command.
* Flips the exit status to true.
* @param i the id of the task that is to be deleted from the list
throw new DukeException("Please enter a valid id");
* Deletes the requested task from the existing list of tasks, notifies the user

* Deadline is a subclass of Task. It is a more specific Task that is a reminder of an important
* due date with its date attached.
* @param details is a String containing information on what the deadline is.
* @param date is a LocalDate object of the date the deadline is due.
* Passes the Deadline object out in readable format.
* @return the readable string giving the Deadline's details.
* Event is a subclass of Task. It is a more specific Task that is a reminder of an important
* @param details is a String containing information on what the event is.
* @param date is a LocalDate object of the date the event will be held.
* Passes the Event object out in readable format.
* @return the readable string giving the Event's details.

* @param details the details of the task.
* Sets the status of the task to true to mark that it has been completed.
* Sets the status of the task to false to mark that it hass not been completed.
* Passes the Task object out in readable format.
* @return the readable string giving the Tasks's details.
* Returns the details of the task, including its description and date where possible.
